basics.name: SangHyuk Kim
basics.label: Machine Psychology Fellow
basics.summary: A Ph.D. student at the University of Massachusetts Boston, specializing in medical imaging and machine learning with over 4 years of experience in software engineering and interdisciplinary research.

work.name: Machine Psychology Lab, University of Massachusetts Boston
work.summary: Conducting Ph.D. research in machine learning and medical imaging, focusing on uncertainty quantification and diagnostic reliability.
highlights: Developed machine learning pipelines with 97.8% accuracy, reducing melanoma misdiagnoses by 40.5%.
Teaching assistant for courses like C++, DBMS, Discrete Mathematics, and Theory of Computing.
Authored a publication nominated for speaker presentation at IEEE ISBI 2025.

work.name: Stanford Research Institute (SRI) International
work.position: Research Intern at NuSCI Research Group
work.summary: Contributed to the SANSA project, focusing on reliable AI for healthcare applications.
highlights: Enhanced melanoma detection by reducing misdiagnoses by 40.5% using uncertainty quantification.
Developed a Python package achieving a 97% detection rate in melanoma detection, presented at IEEE ISBI 2025.
Extended internship offer based on exceptional contributions.

work.name: TmaxOS
work.summary: Fulfilled military service as a software developer with projects in kernel-level programming and smart factory solutions.
highlights: Developed a graphics kernel to enable native execution of Windows applications on Ubuntu.
Led smart factory planning for automated manufacturing
Created a production-ready database system and web applications for enterprise decision-making.

education.summary: Published at a major medical conference in my first year of studies and received recognition for outstanding research contributions.
Developed Smart Glass-based assistive devices for the National Research Institute's Imaging Technology Projects, earning financial support and a tuition waiver.
Selected for the Undergraduate Research Internship and authored a paper on satellite image denoising.

publications.name: Melanoma Detection with Uncertainty Quantification
publications.publisher: 2025 IEEE International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI 2025)
publications.summary: Introduced a novel pipeline for melanoma detection, reducing misdiagnoses by 40.5% with uncertainty quantification.

publications.name: Boostlet.js: Medical Image Processing Plugins for the Web via JavaScript Injection
publications.publisher: 2025 IEEE International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI 2025)
publications.summary: Co-author of a framework enabling medical image processing on web platforms using JavaScript injection.

publications.name: Web-based Melanoma Detection
publications.summary: Proposed a web-based solution integrating machine learning pipelines for melanoma detection.

publications.name: 3D Face Modeling Using Face Image
publications.publisher: Journal of International Society for Simulation Surgery
publications.summary: Explored techniques for constructing 3D face models from single facial images.

publications.name: Pattern Noise Removal Method Using Wavelet-FFT
publications.summary: Presented a pattern noise removal approach combining wavelet and FFT methodologies.

references.name: Daniel Haehn
references.reference: Assistant Professor at the University of Massachusetts Boston *Research Advisor

references.name: Brian Matejek
references.reference: Senior Computer Scientist at SRI International. *Internship Supervisor
